definition: Newton (name)/Sir Isaac Newton (1642-1727), British mathematician and physicist
ox/cow/bull/CL:條|条[tiao2],頭|头[tou2]/newton (abbr. for 牛頓|牛顿[niu2 dun4])/(slang) awesome
to stop/to pause/to arrange/to lay out/to kowtow/to stamp (one's foot)/at once/classifier for meals, beatings, scoldings etc: time, bout, spell, meal
newton meter, unit of torque (symbol: N⋅m)
Sir Isaac Newton (1642-1727), British mathematician and physicist

sentences.english: Newton's law is not applicable to any case.
sentences.chinese: 牛顿定律并不适合于任何情况。

sentences.english: Newton's law of motion forms the foundation of classical mechanics .
sentences.chinese: 牛顿的运动定律构成传统力学的基础。

sentences.english: We update sensitivities matrix by the quasi-Newton method after the first inversion.
sentences.chinese: 在第一次反演之后，采用拟牛顿法更新灵敏度矩阵。

sentences.english: Berkeley took a leaf out of Newton's book by going instrumentalist.
sentences.chinese: 柏克莱借鉴了牛顿的工具主义。

sentences.english: I believe that Newton was different from the conventional picture of him.
sentences.chinese: 我相信牛顿与我们传统印象中的那个人不同。

sentences.english: Millions saw the apple fell but Newton was the one to ask why. - B. M. Baruch.
sentences.chinese: 无数人见过苹果落地，但只有牛顿问过为什么。

sentences.english: We give a quasi-Newton algorithm with nonmonotonic trust region methods for nonlinear equations.
sentences.chinese: 提出了一类解非线性方程的非单调信赖域的牛顿算法。

sentences.english: Comparison method, which measures the metal specific heat capacity in accordance with Newton's law of cooling.
sentences.chinese: 用比较方法，根据牛顿冷却定律测定金属的比热容。

sentences.english: We start with Newton's Second Law, at first referring our problem to an inertial frame.
sentences.chinese: 我们从牛顿第二定律出发，并且先只涉及惯性系。

sentences.english: Therefore, the study of non-Newtonian power law fluid flow law is important.
sentences.chinese: 因此，研究非牛顿幂律流体的渗流规律具有重要意义。

sentences.english: For Newton, alchemy may also have proved bigger than chemistry.
sentences.chinese: 对牛顿而言，炼金术也许也比化学更有用。

sentences.english: So, it is necessary to research the actual non-newtonian fluids.
sentences.chinese: 所以，研究实际的非牛顿流体的传热就非常必要了。

sentences.english: Newton put forward three laws of motion in the book.
sentences.chinese: 在书中，牛顿提出三个运动定律。

sentences.english: Go ahead and buy that hideous, life-size statue of Wayne Newton.
sentences.chinese: 想买那个看上去丑丑的，真人大小的牛顿塑像吗？

sentences.english: The name of the co-discoverer, with Newton, of calculus?
sentences.chinese: 和牛顿同时发现微积分的人叫什么名字？

sentences.english: At present, the traditional Neuton interpolation algorithm is used for zooming.
sentences.chinese: 目前，一般都采用传统牛顿插值算法来实现。

definition: Sir Isaac Newton (1642-1727), British mathematician and physicist
Mikolaj Kopernik or Nicolaus Copernicus (1473-1543), Polish astronomer, mathematician and polymath
Leibnitz (name)/Gottfriend Wilhelm von Leibniz (1646-1716), German mathematician and philosopher, co-inventor of the calculus
Leibniz (name)/Gottfriend Wilhelm von Leibniz (1646-1716), German mathematician and philosopher, co-inventor of the calculus
Maxwell (name)/James Clerk Maxwell (1831-1879), Scottish physicist and mathematician, the originator of Maxwell's laws of electromagnetism and electromagnetic waves
Huygens (name)/Christiaan Huygens (1629-1695), Dutch mathematician and astronomer
